raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.
refined_text: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years. Two years ago, the pain worsened. A plain X-ray revealed advanced osteoarthritis (grade 4). Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs were prescribed for approximately one month, along with muscle relaxants, resulting in mild improvement. She is currently undergoing physiotherapy exercises and will be reassessed after two weeks.

reasoning: The patient has a long-standing history of bilateral knee pain, which worsened two years ago. The chief complaint is bilateral knee pain. The ICD-10 code M17.0 is assigned for bilateral primary osteoarthritis based on the X-ray findings. The history of illness is documented as five years of knee pain with worsening symptoms. Although medications were previously prescribed (NSAIDs and muscle relaxants), there is no indication of current medication. The X-ray results show advanced osteoarthritis. The current plan involves physiotherapy, with a follow-up assessment in two weeks. The assessment is advanced osteoarthritis, grade 4.
